title-group.subtitle: A Critique of Its Selection of Qualified Journalism Educators

abstract.p: Since 1986, the University Grants Commission in India has made it compulsory for all applicants to the position of Assistant Professor to take the National Eligibility Test (NET). This commentary looks at the contents and objectives of the NET and asks whether NET really contributes towards the improvement in the quality of teaching and training in journalism schools.

bio.p: Moina Khan is Assistant Professor at A.J.K. Mass Communication Research Centre, Jamia Millia Islamia University, New Delhi, India. She is currently working for a PhD in community radio while freelancing for newspapers and magazines. She was a radio station producer with India Today Group. E-mail: khanmoina@gmail.com

Surhita Basu works as an Assistant Professor at A.J.K. Mass Communication Research Centre, Jamia Millia Islamia University, New Delhi, India. She is also doing her PhD in International Journalism from the same university. She specializes in online journalism and previously has worked for various online media. E-mail: surhita@gmail.com
